rev.comment: /* Criticism */ Implemented the changes proposed on the talk page.
unexplained deletions
/* Legacy */
/* Inflation */
/* Inflation */ Added another source. LRC: "I am all for competing metals. But a true specie standard is always private, and it always leaves room for competing currencies."
/* Criticism */ del duplicate quotation
/* Origins and etymology */ quotemarks vice italics
/* Differences with neoclassical economics */ fix cite format (?)

/* Inflation */ 1. Added distinction, used by most if not all Austrians. 2. Today, most Austrians (including Ron Paul) define money as whatever is used as medium of exchange, and advocate that the market chooses the money.

obviously monetary inflation is; there's no Austrian economist who thinks price-inflation ("inflation" according to wikipedia) is ALWAYS the result of the central bank (and not technology or mass liquidation)
/* Theories */
/* Capital */
/* Business cycles */
sections too similar to keep apart methinks; there is repetition on "business cycle" as well as "time preference" and "high order of production" (both also a part of ABCT essentially)
/* Theories */
